forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 49. West northwest wind around 16 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.shortForecast: Slight Chance Light Rain then Mostly Sunny
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain before 10am. Mostly sunny. High near 55, with temperatures falling to around 52 in the afternoon. West northwest wind 14 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 24 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%.

weather_report:
As dawn breaks over Downtown San Francisco, a blanket of clouds crowns the skyline, hinting at a day that may begin with whispers of rain. The air carries a crisp chill, draping the city in an enveloping coolness that lingers around 49 degrees. The steady caress of the west-northwest winds, gusting lightly, adds an invigorating energy to the otherwise tranquil atmosphere. Pockets of the marine layer are playing coy, while a mere suggestion of rain falls quietly into the morning, a gentle reminder that the Pacific is never far from this beloved urban expanse.

As we transition through the morning, the sun is poised to break through, scattering the clouds in a dance of brightness. Expect the temperatures to creep upward, settling around 55 before dipping back toward a cooler 52 by afternoon. While the chance of rain lingers, it seems less likely that the day will experience heavy precipitation; rather, it may merely greet us with moments of clarity, punctuated by the occasional misty whisper. A layered approach to attire is wise—perhaps a light jacket to fend off the morning chill, shedding it as the sun establishes its rule over the skies. Consider a leisurely stroll along the Embarcadero, where the vibrant energy of the waterfront complements the gentle lapping of the tides. Or explore the warm atmosphere of a quiet café, where books and conversations thrive in the glow of daylight, offering a perfect sanctuary from the brisk winds.
